intervention_catalogue.name: Building Better Relationships
intervention_catalogue.short_description: Building Better Relationships (BBR) uses cognitive behavioural therapy. It is for men convicted of an intimate partner violence-related (IPV) offence against a female partner.
long_description: Building Better Relationships (BBR) uses cognitive behavioural therapy. It is for men convicted of an intimate partner violence-related (IPV) offence against a female partner.
intervention_catalogue.session_detail: 5 x one-to-one sessions and 25 x group sessions

eligibility_offence.victim_type:
Partner, 
or NON-PARTNER OFFENCES which arise out of intimate partner conflict against a non-partner

risk_consideration.cn_score_guide:
total score of 5+  OASys items 
2.6 - Recognises the impact and consequences of offending 
7.2 - Regular activities encourage offending 
11.4 - Temper control 
11.6 - Problem solving 
11.7 - Awareness of consequences 
11.9 - Understands other people's point of view 
12.1 - Pro-criminal attitudes
risk_consideration.sara_other_score_guide: Medium or high SARA (Spousal Assault Risk Assessment)

special_educational_needs.exclusion_literacy_level_guide: able to read and understand simple sentences

exclusion.remaining_license_community_order_guide: 12 months on licence or at least 18 months on community order
exclusion.mental_health_problem_guide: identified mental illness, or personality disorder
exclusion.literacy_level: able to read and understand simple sentences
